This game would get a much higher score from me if the touch controls weren't the absolute worst I've ever experienced in a mobile port. The most difficult part of the game is getting Adol to go where you want him to. Please play this on PC instead or use a controller.

I thought I could get used to the controls until I hit the dumbest boss in all of Ys. Then I realized that being unable to have a pre-locked location for a movement wheel literally makes this game IMPOSSIBLE on Nightmare. Beaten all Ys series multiple times and it is at the very least for me damn near physically impossible to beat this game due to the movement on tap type of control. This DESPERATELY needs a locked in place movement wheel option.

I love old school RPGs but never played this series. I absolutely love it. Just to let you know, this game supports gamepads and desktop fullscreen is do-able. For Desktop gaming, using DEX mode, and the Desktop HUB app, Ive been able to play Y's on a HDMI monitor fullscreen with my favorite wireless USB gamepad, the Logitech Cordless RumblePad2. For mobile gaming, a great solution is the Gamevice for Galaxy S8 phones, it connects direct to USB-C port. Awesome game, awesome developers!

I can't speak for the touch controls, but this port of Ys Chronicles 1 works perfectly fine with a controller. Its a near perfect port of Ys Chronicles on PSP. My only complaint is that the translation of the game is not up to par with the psp version as well as other games english localizations. Characters often have different names, Darm tower is called Dahm now, and for some reason Cleria is now Krelia. Dialog is also more stilted, but otherwise its a great port. Totally worth the buy.

The overall presentation is nice and appears well optimized on my device. The combat system may seem weird, but other rpgs had a similar style back in the early crpg days. It actually seems appropriate for a touchscreen device. I deducted one star for the translation and grammatical errors but it doesn't affect the story progression.

If you are a fan of Ys, this is an excellent port of Ys Chronicles I. Ys is not a strategic RPG with chesslike battles, but a story-rich action RPG with a very simple combat system. This version does have a little variety in attack though, as moving your finger changes the attack a bit allowing for spinning attacks as opposed to just slamming into the enemy in classic Ys fashion. The classic JRPG (by way of France and the emulator masters at Dotemu) is an entertaining and engrossing story.
The game is a classic and has aged well. -1 star for controls (joystick is sloppy) and -1 star for pestering for a review.
The game is presented beautifully, but it's rather dull, and your dude is more or less uncontrollable when using the on-screen pad. It's a shame, because I was quite excited to play this.

Overall, Ys 1 (Chronicles) is pretty good and I'm enjoying it. I feel the battle system is kinda weak (Granted, I did start with Ys 8) and most of the boss battles are... ridiculous, even on normal difficulty. The touch controls don't really help much with that. However, it's pretty good for what it is - a remake of a super old game that started a classic series. (One last thing, translation seems to be a bit off compared to other versions of Ys Chronicles. Worth noting.)

Controls are really hard to get used to especially since it uses a good 
engine for Dynamics. I could only beat half the game on hard and only on 
easy was I able to finally beat the game. This old game didn't have enough 
story content for me. Also from what I've read in the reviews (and I'm not 
the only one who thinks it) Adol's walking and running setting should be 
easily accessible since bosses are usually faster anyhow. Like put a 
shortcut button to toggle his speed from walking to running. (So you can be 
mid- game and still change it without accessing the menu.)
Old classic had to have it.

No other mobile game has interesting gameplay and an actual story. Ys has 
both and in spades. Best casual pick up and immerse story on mobile. Plus 
it's part of a hugely underrated franchise that is welcome to being further 
explored if you find yourself invested.

Excellent gamepad support, very nice, casual adventure game. Saves are 
local in "/storage/emulated/0/Android/data/com.dotemu.ys1x/data", so 
archive that dir to keep your progress safe and most likely you'll be able 
to use it on another device. Some ports store local saves on your internal 
memory in Android/data, so search there always - it's really a very 
convenient way to let us keep our save states. Use "Octopus" by Beijing 
Chaozhuo Technology Co., Ltd to get keyboard support.

It plays smooth and it's not bad. My only problem is that you can't fight 
more than a few enemies without going back to town to heal. You are 
supposed to attack from the sides and behind but the enemies tracking is 
too good and majority of the time you end up face to face when trying to 
blindside them.

Not a lot of action RPGs, a genre I don't really play just because the 
selection is a bit small when you think of high quality JRPGs. However, 
this game has a certain charm, reminds me fondly of games for SNES (which 
this has kept). Never played this game on another system, this is the first 
time I play this game. Controls: Works well for what you expect. Very easy 
to control the character. This is big because it IS an action RPG and 
therefore, you "bump" into enemies. If the controls sucked, then well, the 
game would suck. Gameplay: its different than most of the JRPGs I tend to 
play, but different is nice! Sometimes you get tired of the same type of 
game! Enjoyable and easy to play in small doses. Gives a HINT for what 
needs to be done next, which is great for pick up n go. Saves: doesn't have 
cloud saving. It needs it. Especially for those who have limited storage 
phones OR for when migrating to a new phone. Should just sync it with 
Google Play Games.

Game looks great, music is also great and the bumper mechanic isn't as bad 
as I thought it was going to be, but the controls is what ruins the game 
for me. I can barely target enemys without just walking past it, and 
letting it hit me. The bad controls are at its worse in the part where you 
escort a girl out of the first dungeon. I got really frustrated losing over 
and over due to the bad controls. I think that adding a 4 direction option 
would be the best bet of solving it. I would've really enjoyed it if the 
controls was good, so I hope you devs are reading this, and plan on 
patching the controls in some way to make it actually playable. And also, I 
tried using a gamepad to try to fix it, but the control problems was still 
there. I am really glad I got this on sale for 99 cents instead of almost 
$6 for it!

Frustrating!!! Stuck on the giant bat boss battle. The control suck. I 
can't even get a single hit because of the controller. Is there any cheat 
to pass this boss battle? This giant bat really ruin everything

I contacted technical support and never received a response from them, 
because my antivirus detected it as potentially dangerous for security and 
privacy. Game uninstalled until they solve the problem and answer me about 
the problem.

I played this on the Wii and PSP aeons ago. This is based off the PSP 
version, which is in many ways the superior version, which was a good 
choice on Falcom and DotEmu's part. I am surprised at how nice the game 
looks on my tablet considering it is a larger and higher resolution than 
the PSP... I guess pixels never go out of style! The music is fantastic, 
and there are three soundtracks you can swap between on the options menu, 
even in-game! The auto save is very nice and fits this platform well, and I 
appreciate the achievements that they implemented. This version is superior 
to all of the others I played because of the fun controls. While Adol kinda 
moves too quickly in towns, his speed comes in handy in battle, and bashing 
your skull into bad guys like a mad man never gets old. Grinding in this 
game is actually fun due to the controls and how Adol simply runs face 
first into enemies as they burst into a pile of blood and body parts in his 
wake. This game is a bit short though, but that's why there is additional 
difficulty settings and a time attack mode. And if you cannot get enough of 
Adol's adventures, part two is available on Google play as well. Buying one 
game and not the other is not recommended. If you enjoy this game, you 
might as well go ahead and get both. They go together like bread and butter.

Also, unlike some of the reviews I read there was no bugged bosses-they're just challenging and some may not have the patience for it.

I love Ys Origins, so I decided to try this out. Installed the app, ran the app. App started to unpack files. I get failed unpacking files at about 96%. Now that's all it ever says. Have no idea how to fix this, and I don't want to restore my phone (cm12.1 tmo note 4). Refunded. I will just get this game on the PC if I can. Edit: Reinstalled, made sure my phone wouldn't go to sleep. Everything works fine now.

This game was enjoyable up until the Bat Boss fight in the Mines. Even with all Silver equipment and the character maxed out at Level 10, this boss is quite literally impossible to beat. There is something wrong with the collision detection, so even when the big bat materializes for half a second and you're lucky enough to hit him, the game doesn't recognize the collision and you just pass right through him like he's not there. Getting killed by the same boss 100 times in a row is not my idea of fun. If the devs fix this bug I'll change my rating. Until then, STAY AWAY!  UPDATE: 4/3/2016 - The lazy devs still haven't fixed this bug. It is my wish that they all suffer kidney stones the size of basketballs for the rest of their lives. UPDATE: 4/4/2016 - After about 300 more tries (no kidding), I finally beat the Bat Boss. I made it through the rest of the game without a hitch, right up to the final boss. Dark Fakt, the last boss, is just as impossible as the Bat Boss. After about 50 tries, I said screw this and I went on Youtube to watch the ending. They seriously need to fix these broken boss battles.

I have enjoyed the YS games and this one has been no exception. Controls are great for a mobile game. My only complaint so far is that I read controllers are supported but my moga doesn't even register with the game which kinda stinks for some of the harder bosses.
I have this game for my PC, PSP and now my phone. Anyone have a life for sell?

A great port of the latest remake of the classic. A little dated compared to YS II. But if you've played the original back in the 80's and are still into gaming today in your 40's, this one is highly recommended. Updated music and visuals are awesome.

The only time you are tested is against the bat boss, which is so broken that I recommend playing the game on easy. What a mess. Also, a very very short game for an rpg. I also should have docked a star for the 1000 fake 4 & 5 star ratings but I didn't.

As a whole this game is simply outstanding. It takes me back to the Golden Era of gaming. It's absolute fun. The storyline is engaging and the combat, while simplistic, is addictive. My only gripe is that there are too many grammatical errors. If it were only a few it wouldn't be a concern, but with there being so many, I am constantly being pulled out of the experience because I have to stop and figure out what is being said. It really takes away from the fabulousness of this game.

This is an awesome, fun, well made game. The combat system, while awkward at first, quickly distinguishes itself as a brilliant system for mobile play and the old school charm makes this game difficult to put down. Until you hit the third boss. Even with the best gear and a maxed out character on the lowest difficulty setting this boss is straight up impossible. Yet Ys is so charming up to that point that it's difficult not recommend, just be warned that you'll probably never make it to the ending credits.

Overall if you haven't played this on ps or pc pick it up if your looking for a game rpg to play.

replyContent: Hi, I'm Maxime from DotEmu. It's the first time that problem appears, so we don't know what we can do with it. I can just tell you to begin a new game and verify if it works correctly. If it doesn't, try to reinstall the game on your device. And if you still have this problem, please contact us at support@dotemu.com, and we'll try to solve it. Bye

content: Love the updates to one of my all time favorite game series on the NEC Turbo Grafx PC Engine!!!  Handles and plays flawlessly!!
Awesome game, cool story line, but terrible controls and really confusing. Otherwise, good game :)

Good: (1) Stable overall. Never experienced crash yet. That's not easy to achieve. (2) Menus are well organized. Again, that's not easy, considering that the original was based on keyboards. (3) It is awesome to have BGM mode selector (chronicle/original = eternal?/PC88). They know old FALCOM gamers are picky and have own strong tastes on the choices.  Bad: (1) It should not "premise" language from the device's language settings. It should be customizible. I want to play the game in Japanese mode (because it makes the best sense to play it in the original language) but hate to use Japanese in my general device settings. Also I'm sure that those non-Japanese gamers who love to play Japanese game very often prefer to read messages in Japanese (for the same reason I explained above). They learn Japanese for that! (2) The app cannot be moved to sdcard while it is huge. It is one of very few apps in 2015 that lacks basic AndroidManifest.xml settings like this. (3) When you ask for feedback, do prefer having menu item for that. No need for disruptive pop-ups. It is a purchased this app, not ad-based freemium app, right?
May you please make some kind of a D-pad for this game it would be a lot easier for some people and not have a joystick.
Great game. Supports controllers and love the new lockable Vpad
Fun to play

I'm 64 years old, started with consoles when they first came out;  while you gamers were kids and played these games, I was already working and had kids, so I could buy them all (not wait for Mom and Dad to get them for me)- I had most all the systems at one time or another: I once bought a 500.00 Turbo Graphics 16 CD, just so I could play Ys Books I and II (500.00 back then was crazy).  Needless to say, I've played and still play the Sega Master and TX16 versions of Ys, so if any of you'reading this has played Y's back in the golden days of gaming, you'll better appreciate this game. Don't give up or judge the game tell you've played a while. I own a JXD game tablet, so might have made play better for me.
Love this game. The bump system is really easy with touch controls. No issues at all so far. Can't wait to see where the story goes!
One of my favorite ARPG now in my cellphone and I can play it whenever and wherever(although the touch control is really challenging). Expecting Ys II!!

This Android port of the first entry in the beloved Ys action RPG series checks all the right boxes. Native controller support? Check. Immersive display mode? Check ☑. Achievements? Yep. Challenging retro game play action? You know it! For a while, I was put off by the "bump attack" gameplay, but I got used to it quickly. Give it a try and you'll be smashing through monsters in no time! Only thing missing is cloud save support. I will update to five stars if added. Square Enix: take a hint. This is how you do a retro port!
Fantastic game. Nothing  bad to tell. Except maybe the cotrols which are a bit weird at first but get better once you get used to them.
You won,t be disappointed with this awesome   game.  Great graphics and story line.
Too short
The touch system is a bit difficult to get used to, but it isn't bad. And the game itself is fantastic. The port is smooth, and it runs well.
I gave it a 4 because there are quite a few mistranslations and the controls are a little strange. But it works well with a touch screen and I look forward to playing the rest of it!

Let me start by saying I love the look and feel of the port... That said I would love to get a fixed dpad, or even an option to not have the dpad follow your finger. Sometimes in the heat of combat I run out of room on my screen, or obstruct the view and have to reposition often ending in my death :-/   -p.s. if this option exists I am unable to find it o.O
Good game

Since they fixed the controls this game rules. Music sounds amazing can't decide which music I like most so I switch back and forth from Origianal, Chronicles, and PC-88. Just wish they had the Turbo Grafix 16 CD version of the music but I understand it's a license thing.   If you are a fan of Ys and want to have it with you in your pocket you need this version.

*update 5/8 I have edited my previous review due to a fairly quick update provided by the dev. It took about a couple of days which is very fast IMO. Great game. Amazing quality of the port and great quick response from the dev after I emailed they assured me they would correct the problem in a future update and here it is a couple of days later. Could not be more satisfied. If you have not played this game before I strongly recommend it

This is a pretty good android port of the already amazing Ys 1, one of the earliest and greatest action RPGs. I had my doubts about how well the bump-style combat would work on a touch screen, but I was pleasantly surprised by how well it works here.  I've seen the bump system criticized a few times, but it should be noted that the bump system for combat was a staple of the early Ys games and an important part of it's gameplay.  If you're looking for a great classic action RPG, look no further than this. My only real complaint with this port is that the translation seems a little off, but that is a minor complaint,
